message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public class FooIterator<E extends Bar> implements Iterator<E> {
  public FooIterator(Collection<E> bars) {
    innerIterator = bars.iterator();
  }
  @Override
  public boolean hasNext() {
    return innerIterator.hasNext();
  }
  @Override
  public E next() {
    return innerIterator.next();
  }
  @Override
  public void remove() {
    throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Don't remove from FooIterator!");
  }
  private Iterator<E> innerIterator;
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can't instantiate a new E because E is a type parameter, not a class. You can't make assumptions about what constructors a type parameter E might have. Instead, you can make E extends Bar, which means E is a subclass of Bar. This way, you can ensure that E has the same constructors as Bar.
